cyber_stalking.title: Cyber Stalking & Online Harassment
cyber_stalking.act: Section 354D of IPC & Section 67 of IT Act
procedure: Step 1: Do NOT delete the messages. Take screenshots.
Step 2: Save the URL of the harasser's profile.
Step 3: File a complaint at cybercrime.gov.in (National Cyber Crime Portal).
Step 4: Visit your nearest police station to file an FIR.

cheque_bounce.title: Dishonour of Cheque (Cheque Bounce)
cheque_bounce.punishment: Imprisonment up to 2 years or fine up to twice the cheque amount
procedure: Step 1: Bank returns the cheque with a 'memo' stating insufficient funds.
Step 2: Send a legal notice to the payer within 30 days of receiving the memo.
Step 3: Give them 15 days to pay.
Step 4: If unpaid, file a complaint in the Magistrate court within 30 days.

rent_dispute.title: Tenant & Landlord Dispute
rent_dispute.act: Model Tenancy Act / State Rent Control Act
procedure: Step 1: Check your Rent Agreement for the notice period clause.
Step 2: Landlords cannot evict without valid notice.
Step 3: Tenants cannot stop paying rent even during disputes.
Step 4: File a petition with the Rent Control Authority (Not Civil Court).

consumer_complaint.title: Defective Product / Service
procedure: Step 1: Send a written complaint to the company/seller.
Step 2: If no response, call National Consumer Helpline (1915).
Step 3: File a case online at e-daakhil.nic.in.
Step 4: No lawyer is required to appear in Consumer Court.

fir_refusal.title: Police Refusing to Register FIR
procedure: Step 1: Send the complaint by Registered Post to the Superintendent of Police (SP).
Step 2: If still no action, file a 'Protest Petition' in the Magistrate Court.
Step 3: The Magistrate can order the police to register the FIR.
fir_refusal.source: Supreme Court Lalita Kumari vs Govt of UP

posh_harassment.title: Sexual Harassment at Workplace (POSH)
posh_harassment.punishment: Termination of the harasser + Compensation to victim
procedure: Step 1: Do NOT suffer in silence. Keep a record of incidents.
Step 2: Submit a written complaint to the Internal Complaints Committee (ICC) within 3 months.
Step 3: If the company has no ICC (less than 10 employees), complain to the Local Complaints Committee (LCC) at the District Collector's office.
Step 4: You can request a transfer or leave during the inquiry.

traffic_challan.title: Wrongful Traffic Challan / Harassment
traffic_challan.punishment: Penalty for Traffic Police Officer (Double the fine amount)
procedure: Step 1: Never bribe. Ask for the official receipt/challan.
Step 2: If the officer harasses you, record a video (it is legal).
Step 3: You can challenge the fine online at the 'Virtual Court' (vcourts.gov.in).
Step 4: Email the complaint to the Traffic Commissioner with proof.

ragging_complaint.title: Ragging in College/University
ragging_complaint.punishment: Suspension, Rustication, or Imprisonment up to 2 years
procedure: Step 1: Call the National Anti-Ragging Helpline: 1800-180-5522 (24x7).
Step 2: File an anonymous complaint at antiragging.in.
Step 3: The Head of Institution MUST file an FIR within 24 hours of the complaint.
Step 4: Failure to act makes the college liable for penalty.

upi_fraud.title: Online Financial Fraud (UPI/Bank Scam)
procedure: Step 1: IMMEDIATELY call 1930 (National Cyber Crime Helpline).
Step 2: This triggers a 'Debit Freeze' on the scammer's account.
Step 3: File a formal complaint at cybercrime.gov.in within 24 hours.
Step 4: Contact your bank for a 'Chargeback' request.

domestic_violence.title: Domestic Violence
domestic_violence.act: Protection of Women from Domestic Violence Act, 2005
procedure: Step 1: Call 1091 (Women Helpline) or Police (112).
Step 2: Contact a 'Protection Officer' (PO) in your district (they file the legal report for free).
Step 3: You have the 'Right to Residence' (cannot be thrown out of the shared house).
Step 4: File a DIR (Domestic Incident Report) via the Magistrate.
